content: Known as the "Father of the Constitution," which U.S. president also served as Secretary of State under Thomas Jefferson?

That would be James Madison. He played a crucial role in drafting the United States Constitution and was instrumental in getting it ratified. Additionally, he served as the Secretary of State under President Thomas Jefferson before being elected as the fourth President of the United States. His contributions to American politics and government are immeasurable, and he is indeed often referred to as the "Father of the Constitution."
